original: Brodmar, Karl Harry, kyrkoherde, Guilaskruv, f. 22/8/96 i Söderàkra, Kalmar 1. G. 23 m. Wera Ekelund. Barn: Bengt f. 25, Olle (fosterb.) 26, Ingrid (fosterb.) 41, Agneta (adoptib.) 43. — Stud:ex. i Lund 16, teol. fil. ex. där 18, teol. kand. 21, prakt. teol. prov samt prästv. f. Vàkjö stift 22. Tjg. s. v. pastor o. v. kommin. i Dör-by-Kläckeberga, v. pastor i Traryd samt m. kort. föroTdn. i Markaryd o. Hallaryd, kommin. i Markaryd 23, kyrkoh. i Hälleberga sed. 31 (tilltr. 34). Miss:styr. ombud sed. 28, Diakonistift. stiftsombud 29-31, förste sekr. o. resesekr. f. Växjö stiftsråd 29-30, stiftsrådets ombud sed. 30, insp. f. Orrefors glas gra vör sk. o. Guillaskruvs föreläsn :fören., ordf. i kyrkofullm., skolstyr., bibl:styr., barnav:nd o. Kon-ga-Uppvidinge komm:förb. Skr.: art., rec. m. m. i hembygdskal, tidn. o. tidskr.
translated: Brodmar, Karl Harry, vicar, Guilaskruv, born August 22nd, 1896 in Söderàkra, Kalmar. Married for the first time in 1923 to Wera Ekelund. Children: Bengt, born in 1925, Olle (fostered) 1926, Ingrid (fostered) 1941, Agneta (adopted) 1943. He completed his studentexamen (final high school exam) in Lund in 1916, theology fil. kand. (bachelor's degree) in 1918, teol. kand. (master's degree) in 1921, practical theology exam and priest ordination in Vàkjö diocese in 1922. He served as a temporary pastor and assistant pastor in Dörby-Kläckeberga, assistant pastor in Traryd and briefly as a board member in Markaryd and Hallaryd. He became a pastor in Markaryd in 1923 and a vicar in Hälleberga in 1931 (appointed in 1934). He was a delegate for the Mission Board since 1928, the Diakonistift's representative from 1929 to 1931, first secretary and travel secretary for the Växjö diocesan council from 1929 to 1930, diocesan council representative since 1930, inspector of Orrefors glass factory and Guillaskruv's lecture association, chairman of church council, school board, library board, child welfare committee and Konga-Uppvidinge municipal association. He wrote articles, reviews and more in local newspapers and magazines.
